ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] A dilema
ygData.msgSnippet: =) Thanks for the kind consideration PsyKo Judges you amiable--Looks like a reasonably safe opponent. Most people don t realise as I already have in my little
ygData.messageBody:
=) Thanks for the kind consideration
PsyKo Judges you amiable--Looks like a reasonably safe
opponent.

Most people don't realise as I already have in my
little time played, that you gain skill points through
combat, and the less skill points you have the less
powerful you are. The red-con-killing twinks aren't
nearly as powerful as their homegrown cousins (us).
Which, is why I play my monk with no armor or weapons.
Things are harder to kill, so I get more skill ups do
to extended combat.

I also like the thought of having a monk that uses no
armor or weapons because, when I die I don't have to
bother looting my corpse, which is a mojor problem for
a lot of low lvl chars.

In ending, I would be interested in hearing some of
the knowledge of other monks on this message board.

Go with peace, Psyko

--- Luis Binnier <shannara200@...> wrote:
> You should stick with your lvl 8 Monk, It sounds
> like
> you have your heart set on that one because you see
> a
> chance to go after dragons. It's nice that you
> thought
> about helping newbies with your mage, but they will
> do
> just fine without the extra help. I have a 43rd
> level
> Human Ranger (Grof Silversky) that I built from the
> beginning with no t'wicks, I hope someday to get
> powerful enough to go after dragons, time will tell.
> Good luck on your journey.
>
> Luis
>
>
> --- PsyKo <sibilant_ghost@...> wrote:
> > Ok, I am trying to decide which character to get
> > settled into. I have a lvl 8 Monk with 209
> NATURAL
> > AC

> > working on it is also lvl 8. With the mage, I can
> > help people in the future, by supplying newbies

> > carefully raised him with very high skill points,
> > and
> > am able to take on lvl 10-12 equiv mobs. The

> > Any help in deciding which one to go further
> with
